Description: Fragment of tondo of Attic black-figured pottery plate. Underside reserved. Part of head of a Gorgon with snake hair.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
From the same plate as AN1896-1908-G128.1 (note that the numbers of the two are reversed in CVA p.91), British Museum 1888,0601.579 and 588.b and Toronto 910x234.43, which joins this fragment.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (IIIh pl. 1, 3.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1917)
Exhibition history: On loan to Classics Centre in Oxford. Previous location: AN Bothmer Cabinet 58.6 Attic Black-Figure
